title: Simulation-Based Multimodal Science Instruction Design: Language-Science Integration Strategies for English Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Basic scientific terminology comprehension and fundamental digital device operation skills
context.additional_context: Conducted in a VR simulation environment using smartphones, emphasizing multimodal activities that simultaneously support science concept learning and English language development

learning_goals: Learners can explain science concepts with over 80% accuracy through multimodal activities integrating gestures, visuals, and verbal explanations in a VR simulation environment.
Learners can construct science sentences, including technical terms, with over 70% accuracy by connecting scientific discourse with everyday language.
Learners can apply multimodal communication strategies (e.g., interpreting visuals, using gestures) three or more times through collaborative simulation tasks with peers.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
